content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

In questions 1-5, determine whether each ordered pair is a solution to the system.

1. \(3x + y > 5\)

    \(2x − y ≤ 10\)


  a. (3,−3)

Correct!  (3, -3) is a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. (3, -3) is a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


  b. (7,1)

Correct! (7, 1) is not a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. (7, 1) is not a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


2. \( 4x − y < 10\)

    \(−2x + 2y > −8\)

  a. (5,−2)

Correct! (5, -2) is not a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. (5, -2) is not a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  b. (−1,3)

Correct! (-1, 3) is a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. (-1, 3) is a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


3. \(y>\frac23x-5\)

    \(x+\frac12y\leq4\)

  a. (6, −4)

Correct! (6, -4) is not a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. (6, -4) is not a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  b. (3, 0)

Correct! (3, 0) is a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. (3, 0) is a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


4. \(y<\frac32x+3\)

    \(\frac34x-2y<5\)

  a. (−4,−1)

Correct! (-4, -1) is not a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. (-4, -1) is not a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  b. (8, 3)

Correct!  (8, 3) is a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. (8, 3) is a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

5. \(6x − 5y < 20\)

    \(−2x + 7y > −8\)

  a. (1, −3)

: Correct! (1, -3) is not a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. (1, -3) is not a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  b. (−4, 4)

Correct! (-4, 4) is a solution to the system.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.13.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. (-4, 4) is a solution to the system. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


6. Two inequalities are graphed on the same coordinate plane. Which region represents the solution to the system of the two inequalities?

Correct! Region D

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 2.13.3 and 2.13.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Region D. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
